creator: bnavon

content:
I would be looking at the fedora firewall for issues or even crashing and restarting. If you are using a VPN with Fedora, get rid of it as a test. Google and VPNs is just a mess really

You might also want to have a look in the password manager to make sure your google oauth password is there for the account and delete any IMAP or SMTP entries as they are not used in the oauth process, but are not removed when you change over.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Does Thunderbird have a workaround for Google's plans please?

Use OAuth authentication as described in the linked article, and use your main Google account password to sign in. Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20
creator: christ1
